Key Match Events: Fernando Cruz struck out 5 batters in the first 2 innings.
Willy Adames hit a three-run homer in the 3rd inning.
Amed Rosario hit a two-run homer in the 6th inning to tie the game at 4-4.
Jackson Chourio hit a home run in the 9th inning to give the Brewers a 5-4 lead.
Devin Williams closed the game for the Brewers, securing a 5-4 victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was featured on national television as one of the FOX national games of the week.
Fernando Cruz's splits show right-handed hitters struggle against him, while left-handed hitters perform well.
Frankie Montas, a former Red, has a 3.33 ERA with the Brewers since being acquired in a trade deadline deal.
Montas's splits indicate right-handed hitters struggle against him, while left-handed hitters perform well.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds' manager David Bell faced criticism for his lineup choices and in-game decisions.
Fans expressed frustration over the team's baserunning and lack of accountability.
Some fans called for the firing of David Bell due to the team's poor performance and frequent one-run losses.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game took place at Great American Ball Park with a forecast of 80° and cloudy conditions.
The Reds made roster moves, calling up David Buchanan from Triple-A and designating Evan Kravetz for assignment.
The Brewers are leading the division with a 79-56 record, while the Reds are 64-72 and out of playoff contention.
